abstracts.cdata!:
The Asset Management Reform Loan (AMRL)
            Project supports improved efficiency in public expenditures,
            by helping rationalize investment, maintenance and
            rehabilitation expenditures in education and health, and
            improve public asset management, in line with the objectives
            of the Country Assistance Strategy (CAS) for expenditure
            rationalization, long-term fiscal sustainability, and
            improved service delivery in the social sectors. The AMRL
            will help Morocco promote a reform targeted towards: a) a
            National Asset Management Policy; and, b) building
            Management Systems for the public Health, Education and
            Higher Education sectors. While the cost of maintenance and
            asset management can be high in the short term, its return
            in the longer term is high. Thus, the project will finance
            the short-term reform costs, and help fill the budgetary gap
            during the period of adjustment. Improving public asset
            management will generate efficiency gains, and
            medium-long-term savings, and improve the maintenance of
            properties. It will also serve  to promote policy dialogue,
            partnership, and ownership, essential not only for the
            implementation of this operation, but also for the long-term
            reforms needed on overall budget and financial management.
            However, securing allocation of adequate resources for the
            purpose of public asset rationalization, and maintenance in
            future budget laws, remains the most difficult element of
            the operation, in view of the rigidity of the budget in
            Morocco. Nonetheless, this risk will be reduced as Morocco
            moves towards a medium term expenditure framework.
